snippet: The Supreme Court heard cases about the limits of the federal government’s ability to regulate power prices and whether an unsolicited deal can halt a class action.
abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments in Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's case against Electric Power Supply Association; also peruses Campbell-Ewald Co case, which asks whether courts may dismiss class-action lawsuits when defendants offer to give plaintiffs everything they seek.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court heard cases about the limits of the federal government’s ability to regulate power prices and whether an unsolicited deal can halt a class action.

headline.main: Justices Delve Into Electricity Markets and Class-Action Demands
headline.print_headline: Justices Delve Into Energy Markets and Class-Action Deals
